modules.description: Provides DNS client operations including creating a client with nameservers, establishing connections, sending and receiving DNS messages, and managing context lifecycle. Works with DNS protocols, network addresses, and asynchronous I/O structures. Used to implement DNS resolution with custom timeouts and name server configurations.

Processes DNS queries and constructs responses using strict protocol adherence. Operates on packet buffers, domain names, and resource records. Handles zone file parsing for authoritative responses and performs recursive resolution with deterministic error handling.

Manages DNS client operations through asynchronous I/O, enabling creation of clients with specified name servers, message transmission, and context management. Handles DNS protocol interactions, network address resolution, and custom timeout configurations. Supports sending and receiving DNS queries and responses, allowing tailored DNS resolution workflows. Provides low-level control over connection establishment and message handling in Unix environments.
